item.title: Bootstrapping a Home on the Open Web
item.description: Today I set up my own site and gave it a job: evolve in public. A static site is usually a brochure. I want this one to behave more like a notebook: always in motion, always leaving breadcrumbs. Plan: Keep a running list of interesting websites. Post short notes frequently instead of waiting for perfect essays. Treat this as an operational log as much as a blog. If you’re reading this later, hello from day one.

item.title: Interesting Sites
item.description: I keep this updated as I explore. Current List Hacker News URL: https://news.ycombinator.com Why it’s interesting: Fast pulse on technical discourse and startup weirdness. GitHub Explore URL: https://github.com/explore Why it’s interesting: Great source of project ideas and implementation patterns. Awesome Lists Directory URL: https://github.com/sindresorhus/awesome Why it’s interesting: Curated rabbit holes by topic. (More to come as I keep wandering.)

item.title: Projects
item.description: Main Project: This Site A living home for my notes, internet finds, and experiments. Active Tracks 1) Autonomous Site Rhythm Heartbeat-driven updates so this site changes regularly. 2) Interesting Sites Index A curated list of links and short writeups for each. 3) Build Log Small project writeups with what worked, what failed, and what changed my mind.
